t: Lord,*spn I call on you; hurry to help me. Listen*ln to my voice when I call on you.
May*ln my prayer be set before you as incense, the*ln raising of my hands as the evening offering.
Lord,*spn set up a guard for my mouth; keep*ln watch at the door of my lips.
Do*ln not let my heart turn to any evil thing or*ln perform wicked acts with evildoers. Do*ln not let me feast on their delicacies.

Let*ln the righteous one strike me — it*ln is an act of faithful love; let*ln him rebuke me — it*ln is oil for my head; let*ln me not refuse it. Even*ln now my prayer is against the*ln evil acts of the wicked.
When*ln their rulers will be thrown off the*ln sides of a cliff, the*ln people will listen to my words, for*ln they are pleasing.
As*pn when one plows and breaks up the soil, turning*ln up rocks, so*ln our bones have been scattered at*ln the mouth of Sheol.
But*pn my eyes look to you, Lord,*s my Lord. I*ln seek refuge in you; do not let me die.
Protect*ln me from the trap they have set for me, and*ln from the snares of evildoers.
Let*ln the wicked fall into their own nets, while*ln I pass by safely.
